result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie J Golder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes:
-No Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobbie J Golder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
8:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - an agreement has been reached.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to amended charge of Disorderly Conduct, will recommend probation.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by defendant - will proceed.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended to Disorderly Conduct.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.  Huber IF revoked.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-No Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:08 a.m.

8:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - does not qualify for PD representation and will proceed on her own.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant requests to meet with the DA.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 30, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:40 a.m.

No Contact with Julia D.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with Julia D.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Julia D.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 16, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:44 a.m.
